item.title: Use the Trezor Hardware Wallet Anonymously Inside a VirtualBox Whonix VM With External Wallets Like Adalite and Monero GUI
item.description: In the past, I used an old laptop running Qubes OS for any cryptocurrency-related stuff, and it worked great. It’s where I first learned about Whonix, a desktop operating system designed to protect your privacy online. Unfortunately, Qubes OS is a bit picky about the hardware it runs on. My old laptop only has four gigs of RAM, and I could barely run two instances of MyEtherWallet in two separate qubes without the system running out of memory.

item.title: Use Sieve Filters to Auto-Sort Your ProtonMail Inbox into Subfolders
item.description: Sieve is a programming language used for email filtering. Today, I show you how I automatically sort my ProtonMail inbox into folders and subfolders using custom sieve filters. My setup uses the catch-all feature requiring at least a ProtonMail Professional subscription and a properly configured custom domain.
